description.narrative: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Good, based on an AIMM score of 53. On an unadjusted basis (i.e., without the likelihood factor), the full potential AIMM score could reach 64. The most significant expected Project-level impacts are derived from (i) economy-wide effects through job creation and value-added generation for the local economy in the Democratic Republic of Congo and (ii) stakeholder effects through increased access to quality bedding products. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will support integration in the light-manufacturing industry in the North Kivu region of the Democratic Republic of Congo, where the market is severely underdeveloped and heavily dependent on imports.

The proposed investment is up to a $5.5 million financing package to Kakivu Mousse SARL, a manufacturer of foam mattresses in Goma, DRC, to upscale current operations by (i) purchasing new equipment; (ii) completing the completing the construction of several warehouses for operations and storage; and (iii) funding permanent working capital. The Project will increase access to quality bedding products in a landlocked, underserved, and fragile area in the DRC.
